title_sort: louisa van velsor whitman to walt whitman, [11–14 november 1868]
title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [11–14 November 1868]
text: dear walti dontdon't want to worry you but i thought i would send you hanna shanna's letter it is rather a strangely connected letter but god only knows what will be the end of her troubles i have got one from him one of his ranting ones i cantcan't tell what an awful letter it is) i wish she could be got here if matty and jeff does go back she could take that room till spring) The erysipluserysipelas generally affects the head so i think probably she will be quite smart) as she gets strenghtstrength doodo you think she gets your letters walter perhaps she does i was thinking maybeemaybe it would be as well to send her one to the care of Dr. Thayer as i suppose he has a box at the post office but doodo as you think best walter dear) i am pretty well matty is about as usual Jeffy will come in a few weeksdontdon'tbe worried no more than you can help walter i know the nature of the disease george would get something in his head and worry as she does about the letter if heyd was kind to her she would get welli wish you had went there walter when you was homeDear MotherBurlington Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [11–14 November 1868]
